body: I would add 'cell' to the cell-action hover text (and in the menu, for that matter).  It's not at all obvious that cut/copy/paste are _not_ in fact normal cut/copy/paste.

Me like it!!   This is great, Brian.  I also love the ability to toggle the header and toolbar.  This is shaping up all kinds of awesome.

> - Are these the right actions?  Any others to add?

These look right, the only one that comes to mind is the 'trash' icon, which could be used to answer a recurring request on the list: the whole "I don't like my directories to get polluted with Untitled*.ipynb files" (to be honest it also bugs me a bit).  The trash could represent 'close notebook, kill kernel and delete file'.

Otherwise, I'd say let's leave it as is and go slow.  I think eventually, when the structural cells have landed and are well integrated, and once we also have worksheet tabs, I think we'll want to have a bunch of run options: this section, this  page, this notebook, etc.  At that point it might be cool for the run arrow to work like back arrows in browsers do: default is 'run all', but if held it provides a submenu.  Or we can use the other play-like arrows (fast forward and skip) to represent some of those actions too.

But that will come later, so for now I'd leave it as-is.  Also, I'd rather be really conservative in what we add here, so we don't overpopulate it too early.  Later if we realize we need space and remove _anything_, somebody somewhere is bound to complain.

Here are some other possibilities to think about, but I'm fine if we wait on all  of these. I just want to put them out for discussion:
- 'home' to go to the dashboard.

## \- 'new document' to create a new notebook.

> - Are these the right icons?  See the jquery ui themes for the icon sets.

These all look pretty good to me, the only one that's not super clear immediately is the floppy save one.  But I can't find a better one in the icon set.  I do see a bunch there that give me cool ideas for the future, though :)

> - New View menu that allows the hiding of the header and toolbar.

I _love it_!

> - Cell types are now selected in a select box.

This is perfect.

So from me, this is almost ready to go.  Consider the trashcan idea, and I agree with Min on the 'cell' word in the mouseovers.  As for the menus, we'd discussed it one evening and kept them off, but I'm OK if you also put them in the menus...

Fantastic job, Brian!

Looking great! Quick access to buttons was the first thing I missed when trying out the HEAD compared to 0.12.  Some reactions:
- The buttons aren't showing up correctly in Chrome on OS X (they show as actual push buttons with words rather stylized buttons with icons). The actions in the view menu also do not work. Everything is working fine in Firefox 9 though...
- Perhaps the toolbar could be toggled by clicking on a divider---similar to the way the button pane functions in 0.12? This seems like it might be more efficient.

Charlie,

I think you have an ealier version of the branch before it was
finished.  I would re-pull (you will have to do ao force pull as I
have rebased).

@fperez:  glad you like it.  I am pretty pleased with how it turned out myself.
- Let's wait on the Trash Button Icon and handle that in a separate
  PR.  I am a little hesitant to make trashing the entire notebook
  "easy" (a button, even with a confirmation UI is a bit too easy)
  because of the severe and complete loss of data.  There is also the
  possible confusion with Trash = Delete _Cell_.  I agree we should
  think about these things, but keep this PR focused on adding buttons
  for existing actions/menu items.
- I like your approach to take it slow in adding things to the
  toolbar.  Taking things away will always be more difficult and as any
  user of MSFT Word knows, a overly busy toolbar gets really cluttered
  and unusable quickly.
- Yes there are some inspiring icons in the jQueryUI icon set.

> However, I just re-installed the `nbtoolbar` branch and everything is now working fine in Chrome. Weird.

It's possible you hadn't fully refreshed your javascript.  Today I was
working with a colleague and the editor was behaving incomprehensibly
bad (no text selection, tab would paste random blocks, just weird).  I
thought one of the PRs had some bad bug, but it all turned out to be
just a matter of hitting reload in the browser a few times in a row.

Browser caches can really play a trick on you if you're changing
branches quickly, so keep that in mind as you experiment.
